title: Bihar Assembly Election LIVE updates: BJP says seat-sharing talks between allies are ‘positive’; Chirag remains tight-lipped
content: The EC has directed political parties to refrain from misusing AI-based tools to create deepfakes that distort information or spread misinformation on social media

title: Buffering Karnataka’s waterbodies
content: In the recently concluded monsoon session, the Karnataka government introduced the Karnataka Tank Conservation and Development Authority (Amendment) Bill, 2025, which amends the 2014 Act to define graded buffer zones around tanks based on their size. While there is no universally accepted definition of buffer zones, in many countries they are designated areas around waterbodies intended to minimise the negative impacts of human settlements, writes Chetan B.C.

title: Official crime data does not reflect women’s ordeal in Manipur 2023 conflict
content: Data show a spike in criminal activity in the State in 2023, but a drop in reported crimes against women during the conflict

title: Coldrif cough syrup banned in Bengal after child deaths linked to it in Madhya Pradesh
content: "The batch linked to the Madhya Pradesh incident has not entered West Bengal, but as a precautionary measure, we have informed all sellers to stop its sale," BCDA secretary Prithwi Basu said.

title: Chandigarh police registers FIR in Haryana IPS officer death case
content: When asked about the next course of action, a Chandigarh police official said, "We will investigate the allegations which have been levelled."

title:
Natarajasundaram Pillai, the nagaswaram
player who excelled in complex rhythms
content:
Pallavi Natarajasundaram Pillai, as he was known, was renowned for mallaris. The available recordings are an invaluable documentation of his style and a testimony to his astonishing grip on layam or thalam. There would be no dull moment in a concert by Natarajasundaram Pillai, says thavil  maestro 
Haridwaramangalam A.K. Palanivel

title: When Justice Party contemplated admitting Brahmins into its fold nearly 100 years ago
content: B. Munuswami Nayudu, the Chief Minister of Madras Presidency during 1930-32, tried in vain to admit ‘willing’ Brahmins to the party. At the party’s Nellore confederation in October 1929, he sought to amend the by-laws because the exclusion of one community had resulted in the party not being a ‘full representative’ of the Presidency

title: Remembering C. Minakshi, a trailblazing scholar and authority on Pallava history
content: She was the first woman to receive a doctorate from the University of Madras in 1936. In four years as a professional historian, she published over 30 articles and four books. In 1939, the ASI asked her to study the sculptures at the Vaikuntaperumal Temple in Kancheepuram. This work remains an authoritative reference on Pallava art

title: Interview | Author and Rajya Sabha MP Salma on juggling writing and politics
content: A new translation of Salma’s first novel, The Dark Hours of the Night, foregrounds the voices of marginalised women

title: Shiv Sena (UBT) demands to sack Mahayuti Minister over granting weapon licence to criminal’s brother
content: Yogesh Kadam allegedly overruled a police report to grant a gun licence to Sachin Ghaywal, the brother of notorious Pune gangster Nilesh Ghaywal

title: Bhupendra Patel outlines roadmap for ‘Viksit Gujarat, Viksit Bharat’
content: Under these plans, more than 500 projects have been identified, supported by investments exceeding ₹15 lakh crore

title: Rajasthan CM seeks expatriate Rajasthanis’ support for gems, jewellery hub
content: Bhajan Lal Sharma said Rajasthan was poised to become a 350 billion U.S. dollar economy and had an investment-friendly environment

title: Ruling NC MLA brings private member’s Bill to restore pre-2019 Land Grants Act in J&K
content: He said the Bill also sought to protect lawful occupants from eviction, ensure transparent renewals, and prioritize land grants for residents, cooperatives and local entrepreneurs

title: Centre’s Samanvaya platform traces about 1.52 lakh cybercrime links, facilitating 12,987 arrests
content: The platform is one of the verticals of Indian Cyber Crime Coordination Centre (I4C) for inter-States/Union Territories coordination

title: Athawale seeks action under SC/ST Act against man who tried to hurl shoe at CJI Gavai
content: The incident took place because some people from upper caste could not come to terms with the fact that Justice Gavai, from Dalit community, has risen to such a high position, says the Union Minister

title: Expenses, income gap huge in farm sector: All India Kisan Sabha
content: AIKS leaders blame the Centre not implementing the C2+50% M.S. Swaminathan commission formula; Minister refutes charges, says MSP is decided after consultations with farm outfits

title: Delhi HC directs EC to allot election symbol to Akhil Bharatiya Jan Sangh for Bihar polls
content: The party in its plea said that the non-allotment of a symbol will take away its opportunity to contest elections

title: BJP Govt in Odisha reacts sharply to W.B. CM’s comment on Cuttack communal violence
content: Number of arrests has gone up to nine following fresh arrests of three persons in connection with the violence

title: Mamata says EC officials ‘threatening’ West Bengal govt. officers
content: CM says there are attempts to conduct a National Register of Citizens in the garb of SIR in the State

title: Odisha Police widen probe into recruitment scam
content: Raid was conducted on a prominent coaching centre of Bhubaneswar to ascertain any possible link between the coaching centre, job seekers, and the scamsters

title: Register FIR against Bajrang Dal members for molesting tribal women: Chhattisgarh women’s panel on nuns’ case
content: Complainants alleged that Bajrang Dal workers assaulted, abused, molested, and used casteist slurs at  them at Durg railway station

title: Kunbis call off a day-long protest after meeting Maharashtra Skill Minister Lodha
content: Protesters demand withdrawal of GR granting Kunbi caste certificates to Marathas, caste-wise census, and protection of OBC reservation rights.

title: Haryana IPS officer’s death: Oppn. steps up heat on BJP govt., calls for impartial probe
content: Wife urges CM to intervene, register FIR against people named in ‘note’ left behind by deceased officer; Saini visits residence to offer condolences

title: Panathuthazham flyover: Kozhikode MP alleges negligence on govt.’s part
content: The project remains stalled because the land acquisition process was never even started, claims M.K. Raghavan

title: The Hindu Group’s coffee-table book on legendary illustrator Maniam released
content: Veteran actor Sivakumar, an artist himself, released the first copy of the book, produced in association with Maniam Selven, the son of the late illustrator

title: Supreme Court rejects Centre’s plea for stricter timelines for execution of death row convicts
content: The top court said its 2014 Shatrughan Chauhan judgment, which the Centre sought to modify, was comprehensive and required no further review

title: Modi, Starmer call for a ‘two-state solution’ to Israel-Palestine conflict
content: Two Prime Ministers support “an immediate and lasting ceasefire”; Modi speaks with Trump over phone, congratulates him on Gaza peace initiative

title: Draft labour policy violates tripartite process: AITUC
content: Discussions with the CTUs as the main stakeholders before drafting such a policy is a standard and crucial practice established in India

title: Goal is to create 1 lakh blue-collar jobs through OMCAP, says Lokesh
content: Instructs officials of Skill Development Corporation to prepare a roadmap and move forward in a planned and systematic manner to achieve the goal

title: BJP’s Manipur MLAs meet Patra, seek end to President’s Rule
content: The group of MLAs conveyed to State in-charge Sambit Patra that there is “no infighting” within State BJP and that the Home Ministry should revoke President’s Rule and reinstate the popular government

title: What are the various electoral forms? | Explained
content: What is Form 6 used for in the context of electoral rolls? How can Overseas Electors register to vote? Which forms are used to raise objections or request corrections? What should citizens do to ensure their names are correctly included in the electoral rolls?

title: ‘Peace talks’ held in Leh; mobile Internet services restored
content: The first such meeting since the violence erupted on September 24 was chaired by Ladakh Chief Secretary Pawan Kotwal; the meeting was attended by LAB chairman Thupstan Chhewang and co-chairman Chering Dorjay Lakruk, representatives of Buddhist organisations, Muslim bodies, Christian groups and leaders of the Congress and the BJP

title: PM Modi to launch initiatives to boost pulses production
content: Schemes target higher cultivation area, productivity; over 1,100 agri projects worth ₹42,000 crore to be inaugurated

title: Operation Numkhor: Customs seize three more vehicles
content: A Nissan Patrol, a Nissan Pickup Truck, and a Toyota Prado seized in Kochi. Total number of vehicles seized under Operation Numkhor now 43

title: Lok Sabha Speaker urges ethical adoption of AI to bridge the digital divide
content: Om Birla said that cooperation and knowledge-sharing can make technology a bridge rather than a barrier

title: Congress slams Modi’s praise for Israeli PM
content: Congress general secretary (communications) Jairam Ramesh criticises PM Narendra Modi for failing to mention the ongoing expansion of Israeli settlements in the occupied West Bank or the devastating toll of the Gaza war

title: India sees increase in international and domestic airfares from 2019 to 2025
content: The 2025 trends were released by the Airports Council International Asia-Pacific & Middle East, the trade association representing airports

title: Help excluded Bihar voters file appeals: Supreme Court to legal aid workers
content: Experience in State must have made EC wiser ahead of pan-India SIR, says court; information about the 3.66 lakh excluded from list should be collated by the legal service authority and submitted as a status report to the court in a week, it added

title: West Bengal Police arrest five accused in attack on BJP MP, MLA in flood-hit Jalpaiguri
content: Meanwhile, two petitions were filed at the Calcutta High Court urging a probe by central agencies into the attack

title: Supreme Court says retrospective age limits under surrogacy law violate reproductive autonomy
content: The top court was hearing applications moved by 3 couples who challenged the age bar of 23 to 50 years for women and 26 to 55 years for men under the Surrogacy Regulation Act, 2021

title: Singer Anuradha Dhareshwar is no more
content: The 87-year-old former announcer at All India Radio Dharwad was one of the earliest light vocal singers of Karnataka

title: India to launch ‘Red List’ survey to assess extinction risks to plants and animals
content: India conducts comprehensive assessment of 11,000 species to determine extinction vulnerability, aligning with global conservation standards by 2030

title: CAG report flags flaws in e-way bill system under GST
content: CAG recommends government to get National Informatics Centre, which manages the e-way bill common portal, to correct the system deficiencies

title: ‘Indira food kit’ to replace five kg rice under Anna Bhagya scheme
content: The kit will benefit about 4.48 crore population holding below poverty line cards and will include tur dal, oil, sugar and salt

title: BJP says seat-sharing talks between allies are ‘positive’; Chirag remains tight-lipped
content: Paswan says he has ‘responsibilities of the Ministry as long as he remains a Union Minister’, delivering a subtle message to BJP amid talks about seat-sharing for Bihar polls

title: Dodgers advance to NLCS after Kerkering's error
content: The Dodgers beat the Phillies 2-1 on Thursday to advance to the NLCS. The Phillies' Orion Kerkering made a wild throw past home instead of throwing to first after mishandling a bases-loaded comebacker with two outs in the 11th inning.

title: LeBron out 3-4 weeks, set to miss Lakers opener
content: Lakers star LeBron James will be sidelined an additional three to four weeks because of sciatica on his right side, the team announced Thursday.

title: Chiefs' Jones owns up to not chasing Lawrence
content: Seen watching as Trevor Lawrence scrambled for the Jaguars' winning touchdown over the Chiefs, Chris Jones said he will do better going forward and that such an incident "won't happen again."

title: Bengals say Flacco trade gives team 'a chance'
content: Bengals' receiver Ja'Marr Chase said that the team trading for Joe Flacco is a sign of the belief the franchise still has for this season.

title: Ex-Fins safety Jones awarded $9.5M in fraud suit
content: Former Dolphins safety Reshad Jones has settled a lawsuit against Merrill Lynch for $9.5 million after a former financial adviser allegedly stole $2.59 million from the two-time Pro Bowler.

title: Shedeur: Whatever Browns role is 'I'm thankful'
content: Shedeur Sanders said Thursday he'll be fine with whatever decision Browns coach Kevin Stefanski makes on the team's backup quarterback role following the trade of Joe Flacco.

title: Greenwell, 2-time All-Star for Red Sox, dies at 62
content: Mike Greenwell, who played his entire 12-year career with the Red Sox and finished second in the 1988 AL MVP voting, has died at age 62.

title: 🏈 Fantasy football playbook for Week 6
content: An all-encompassing look at the matchups to exploit or avoid and lineup locks in fantasy, as well as projected scores for all NFL games.

title: Week 7 preview: Key conference matchups, Oklahoma's 'Dog Pound' defense and more
content: Our college football experts give us insight on key Big Ten and SEC matchups, plus Oklahoma's defense.

title: CFP Bubble Watch: Who's in, who's out, who has work to do in each league﻿
content: Putting the spotlight on select teams and questions around others as the early playoff picture takes shape.

title: Ranking the NFL's eight divisions from first to worst -- including one that could have four playoff teams
content: Can any division match the NFC North? How do QB injuries impact the AFC North's standing? And which division lands at the bottom of our list?

title: Has the rookie RB class lived up to its predraft hype? Barnwell breaks down five standouts
content: The rookie RB class could end up being elite. Let's look closer at Jacory Croskey-Merritt and others.

title: The NBA's next Chosen One will be ... tough to predict: Five paths the face of the league could follow
content: ESPN analyst Zach Kram explores the players who could follow in Steph Curry's and LeBron James' footsteps.

title: Kung Fu, meditation and a 'Dream Shake': Inside Victor Wembanyama's return
content: A 'traumatic experience' with deep vein thrombosis prompted a summer of exploration for the Spurs star.

title: Offseason questions for eliminated teams: What's next for Phillies after NLDS defeat
content: Here's how the winter looks in Philly -- and in the other towns whose teams lost their final postseason game.

title: WWE Crown Jewel preview: Rollins-Rhodes, Cena tour stop, more
content: As WWE Crown Jewel heads to Perth, Western Australia, we break down the biggest storylines, including John Cena's retirement tour.

title: Inside WNBA players' rocky relationship with commissioner Cathy Engelbert
content: Napheesa Collier's scathing criticism was only the most recent example of players' eroding trust in the WNBA commissioner.

title: WNBA Finals Game 3 guide: How the Aces beat the Mercury
content: Everything that happened in Game 3, including A'ja Wilson's historic night and Satou Sabally's injury.

title: No gap year here: How the Celtics and Pacers approach a season without their leaders
content: Despite injuries to Tyrese Haliburton and Jayson Tatum, the Pacers and Celtics are still approaching the 2025-26 season as win now.

title: Wyshynski predicts every NHL team's finish in 2025-26
content: As the season begins, we reveal which teams will make the Stanley Cup Final, the playoffs and the draft lottery.

title: How the Ducks are building a new Western power
content: After patiently developing a collection of impressive young talent, the ingredients are now there to contend.

title: 75 stadiums, 45 states, one vision: Why the Savannah Bananas' next step is its biggest yet
content: The Savannah Bananas prepare for a new era of bodacious baseball. Check out what "Banana Ball" is doing next.

title: The race to be No. 9: Which strikers will the USMNT take to the World Cup?
content: The USMNT's history of productive strikers is limited, but ahead of the World Cup, several are in the form of their lives. So who will make the team?

title: The best teams in Europe right now: Bayern, Kane setting the tone
content: Bayern Munich's start to the season has been astonishingly good, but where does the rest of Europe fall in Bill Connelly's rankings?

title: Rogers enters No. 10 debate for England, but who will Tuchel end up trusting?
content: Taking advantage of some absences, has Morgan Rogers done enough to ensure a permanent starting role?

title: Should you move on from Jameson Williams, A.J. Brown or other disappointing picks?
content: Matt Bowen discusses eight players who have fallen short of expectations early on, and how to value them.

title: Expert picks, best bets: Can Brazilian Charles Oliveira stay unbeaten in his home country?
content: Din Thomas and Anthony Smith pick the UFC Fight Night Rio main event, and Ian Parker gives value picks for the card.

title: How six fighters could test Terence Crawford's boxing skills
content: After a dominating win over Canelo Alvarez, forget about a rematch. Here are six fights for Terence Crawford to enhance his legacy.

title: 'You're just poking the bear': Bucs' Wirfs recalls fan heckling Baker in Seattle
content: Buccaneers left tackle Tristan Wirfs witnessed Baker Mayfield's trash-talking exchange with a Seattle Seahawks fan last Sunday.

title: Angel Reese to become first professional athlete in Victoria's Secret Fashion Show
content: The Chicago Sky star will make history as the first professional athlete to walk in the fashion show.

title: Early 2026 boys' recruiting class rankings: The surprise SEC team on top
content: With only one top-10 player committed, some surprising programs have emerged with the strongest classes so far.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Chelsea to return for Juve's Yildiz
content: Chelsea are lining up another approach for Juventus' Kenan Yildiz. Transfer Talk has the latest news and rumors.

title: College football best bets for Week 7: Why an 0-5 team should be on your bet slip
content: Pamela Maldonado breaks down her favorite bets for Week 7 of the college football season, including what makes UMass-Kent State a solid game to bet.

title: Survivor pool strategy: Packers, Broncos among top options in Week 6
content: Predictions and picks for ESPN Eliminator Challenge Week 6, including teams to pick or save for later.

title: Draft guide: All you need to win your league this season
content: We've got everything you need to help you prepare for and execute a successful draft, all in one place.

title: 7.6 magnitude earthquake hits Philippines; tsunami warning issued
content: A powerful 7.2 magnitude earthquake jolted the Mindanao region of the Philippines on Friday. The seismic event originated at a considerable depth of 62 kilometers, according to the European-Mediterranean Seismological Centre. This significant tremor has raised concerns across the affected area, prompting immediate attention and further investigation into its impact.

title: Ganguly shuts down Rohit Sharma sacking talk: 'It happened to me & Dravid'
content: Sourav Ganguly clarified Rohit Sharma's ODI captaincy change, calling it a natural career progression, not a sacking. He cited his and Dravid's experiences, emphasising age as a factor for players like Rohit, who will be 40 in 2027. Ganguly backed Shubman Gill's appointment, praising his England performance and potential as a future leader.

title: 7-year-old Ukrainian child killed after Russia launches missile and drone strike
content: Kyiv faced a massive Russian assault Friday, with ballistic missiles and drones targeting the capital's critical infrastructure, causing widespread power outages and wounding at least nine. The national energy grid is under severe attack, according to officials.  Meanwhile, Zaporizhzhia also suffered drone strikes. Moscow's intensified aerial campaign aims to sow chaos, while Ukraine retaliates with strikes on Russian territory.

title: Google changes work policy: ‘Work From Anywhere’ can’t be used for WFH; sends memo
content: Google is tightening its "Work from Anywhere" policy, now counting any day worked remotely outside the office as a full week. This change, separate from the existing hybrid schedule, aims to prevent WFA from substituting regular remote work. Employees are also restricted from using WFA days to work from other Google offices due to legal and financial concerns.

title: Top stocks to buy: Stock recommendations for today - check list
content: Stock market recommendations: Bajaj Broking Research highlights Jayaswal Neco Industries and Bank of Baroda as top stock picks for October 10, 2025. The Nifty and Bank Nifty are showing signs of consolidation after strong rallies.

title: ‘Awarded for nothing’: Trump rips into Obama over Nobel Peace Prize; pitches self
content: President Trump, eyeing the Nobel Peace Prize, criticized Barack Obama's award while highlighting his role in a US-brokered peace deal between Israel and Hamas. The agreement, which secured the release of hostages and Palestinian prisoners, was announced as Trump prepared to travel to Egypt for its signing.

title: China to India: 'Promise' that rare earth magnets supplied will not be re-exported to US
content: China has tightened rare earth export controls, restricting processing technology and targeting defense and semiconductor users. Beijing is reportedly seeking guarantees from India that its heavy rare earth magnets will not be re-exported to the US, aiming to use these controls as a bargaining chip in trade talks.

title: 'Didn't take responsibility': Harmanpreet Kaur rips top order after loss to South Africa
content: India's captain Harmanpreet Kaur expressed disappointment after the team's three-wicket loss to South Africa, citing the top order's failure to take responsibility. Despite Richa Ghosh's brilliant 94, South Africa's Nadine de Klerk and Laura Wolvaardt secured a memorable victory. Kaur praised Ghosh's performance, while de Klerk celebrated her Player of the Match award.

title: In talk with Donald Trump, PM Modi hails success of Gaza peace plan
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi congratulated US President Donald Trump on the "historic" Gaza peace plan and discussed "good progress" in trade negotiations. The leaders agreed to stay in close touch, hinting at a potential meeting. PM Modi also joined UK PM Keir Starmer in supporting the US peace plan, emphasising a lasting and just peace with a Two-State solution.

title: Zoho's Sridhar Vembu sends ‘Thank You’ message to Amit Shah; dedicates it to engineers
content: Union Home Minister Amit Shah has switched to Zoho Mail, India's homegrown email platform, a move celebrated by Zoho co-founder Sridhar Vembu. This decision aligns with the government's push for digital sovereignty and boosts the adoption of Indian tech solutions. Shah's endorsement signifies a growing confidence in the nation's indigenous digital infrastructure.

title: Why Russell Wilson won’t play against Eagles: QB’s Message to Wife Ciara
content: The New York Giants have benched veteran quarterback Russell Wilson for Jaxson Dart in their Week 6 game against the Eagles, marking Wilson's third consecutive game on the sidelines due to performance issues. Despite professional challenges, Wilson finds strength in his family, including wife Ciara and their children, and remains ready to contribute if called upon.

title: Taylor Swift jokes Travis Kelce is surrounded by his ‘hot friends’
content: Taylor Swift recently revealed that fiancé Travis Kelce has “hot gay friends,” sparking fan speculation. Speaking on Hits Radio, she confirmed their fun-loving nature while referencing her own LGBTQ+ circle. Kelce has previously expressed support for queer teammates. Fans are curious if any NFL stars are part of his inner circle, adding intrigue to the couple’s high-profile romance.

title: Brittany Mahomes stuns in Abercrombie NFL collection; Randi cheers
content: Brittany Mahomes has launched a stylish new NFL apparel line with Abercrombie & Fitch, showcasing custom Kansas City Chiefs outfits. The collaboration, shot at Arrowhead Stadium, highlights her entrepreneurial spirit and family pride, earning praise from fans and mother-in-law Randi Mahomes. This venture comes as the Chiefs navigate a challenging season, with Brittany encouraging fans to support the team.

title: Gisele Bündchen’s former Manhattan townhouse lists for $17M after 20 years
content: Gisele Bundchen's former New York City home is now for sale. The elegant townhouse in Manhattan's West Village is listed at $16.995 million. Bundchen owned the property about 20 years ago. The historic home offers refined living space and modern amenities. This property represents a piece of supermodel history in a sought-after neighborhood.

title: Saquon Barkley injury update: Eagles star set to play against Giants tonight
content: Despite a recent loss to the Denver Broncos, the Philadelphia Eagles, Super Bowl LIX champions, are set to face the New York Giants. Star running back Saquon Barkley, who had a sore knee after the last game, has recovered and will play against his former team. Barkley expressed his understanding of football's challenges and the importance of enjoying the process.

title: Shoe attack bid not a joke, an affront to institution, says judge on CJI bench
content: Chief Justice of India BR Gavai stated he and Justice K Vinod Chandran were shocked by a lawyer's shoe-throwing attempt on October 6, calling it a "forgotten chapter." The incident, which drew widespread condemnation, occurred while the CJI was hearing environmental clearance review pleas. Former Justice Markandey Katju, however, suggested the CJI's remarks about Lord Vishnu invited the incident.

title: Record alert! Richa Ghosh creates history with highest-ever score at No 8
content: Richa Ghosh achieved a historic feat, scoring the highest-ever 94 by a batter at No. 8 or lower in Women's ODIs against South Africa. Her remarkable innings, featuring 11 fours and four sixes, propelled India to 251. Despite this individual brilliance, India faced a three-wicket defeat in a match that also saw both No. 8 batters score fifties.

title: Cough syrup toll at 23; Tamil Nadu pharma owner held
content: The death toll from adulterated cough syrup reached 23 after two more children died of renal failure. Police arrested the owner of Tamil Nadu-based Sresan Pharmaceuticals, which manufactured the contaminated Coldrif medicine. Investigations revealed the syrup was laced with DEG, an industrial solvent, leading to widespread seizures and a political blame game between state governments.

title: In meet with Keir Starmer, PM Modi stresses need to move against economic fugitives
content: Prime Minister Modi and UK counterpart Keir Starmer met to bolster bilateral ties, focusing on defense cooperation, including military training and missile systems. Both leaders committed to enhancing collaboration in the Indo-Pacific and promoting multilateralism, with the UK reiterating support for India's UNSC aspirations. Discussions also covered economic trade, technology partnerships, and critical minerals.

title: ‘LPG cylinder’ blast kills 5, razes 2-storey house in Ayodhya village
content: A massive explosion in Ayodhya's Pagla Bhari village destroyed a two-storey house, killing five people, including the owner and his two children. The blast, reportedly triggered by an LPG cylinder, scattered debris over a wide radius. Investigations are underway to determine the exact cause, with preliminary reports ruling out firecrackers.

title: Haryana youth feared killed fighting for Russia
content: A youth from Hisar, Sonu, is feared dead in the Russia-Ukraine war, with his companion Aman missing since September 22. Both men were reportedly deceived into joining the Russian army after going to Russia for a foreign language course. Families have sought help from the MHA and the Indian embassy in Moscow.

title: India-US ties: Government will be cautious on trade talks, says official
content: Prime Minister Modi and President Trump discussed trade following Indian negotiators' return from Washington. Despite past experiences with the US administration, India hopes for a softened stance, though caution remains. Navigating Russian oil purchases is crucial for any potential trade deal.

title: Tejashwi Yadav’s big poll pledge: A government job for every household
content: Tejashwi Prasad Yadav, RJD leader and INDIA bloc chairman, has pledged a government job for every household in Bihar. He promises to introduce the legislation within 20 days of forming the government and ensure its implementation within 20 months. This move aims to address the significant unemployment issue in the state.

title: Don't let extremists abuse freedoms: PM Modi to Starmer
content: Prime Minister Modi met with his UK counterpart Keir Starmer. They focused on strengthening the India-UK trade deal. Cooperation in the Indo-Pacific region was also a key discussion point. Technology, defence, and security partnerships were explored. PM Modi raised concerns about anti-India activities by Khalistan separatists. The need to act against economic fugitives within legal frameworks was also emphasized.

title: 'Strategic convergence': Amid Trump’s disinterest in Quad, India & Aus ink 3 pacts; strengthen defence ties
content: India and Australia have deepened their defence cooperation. Three key pacts were signed to enhance information sharing and military interoperability. Both nations are committed to a free and open Indo-Pacific. This collaboration comes as regional security concerns grow. The agreements aim to bolster maritime security and strategic partnerships.

title: Strategic significance: Chenab hydel project set to get green clearance
content: India has greenlit the 1,856-MW Sawalkot hydroelectric project on the Chenab River in Jammu and Kashmir, a significant move following the suspension of the Indus Waters Treaty. This run-of-the-river project, estimated at Rs 31,380 crore, aims to boost India's hydropower generation capacity and better utilize its share of western river waters.

title: Supreme Court to ADR: Seems there is too much passion and little reason
content: The Supreme Court questioned the veracity of an NGO's affidavits alleging voter list deletions in Bihar, with the Election Commission pointing out falsehoods. While directing an inquiry into deletions, the court expressed skepticism about the NGO's claims due to unsubstantiated allegations and a perceived lack of reason.

title: India's purchase of Russian oil figures in talks, says UK PM Keir Starmer
content: UK PM Keir Starmer confirmed discussions with PM Modi regarding India's purchase of Russian oil amidst the Ukraine conflict. Starmer highlighted the 'coalition of the willing's' efforts, including measures against Russia's 'shadow fleet,' aimed at ending the war. He also praised the peace deal on Gaza as a significant breakthrough.

title: PM Modi, Keir Starmer condemn terror in all its forms and manifestations
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi and UK counterpart Keir Starmer strongly condemned terrorism, including the Pahalgam attack, and pledged zero tolerance. They agreed to counter radicalisation, combat terror financing, and prevent the exploitation of new technologies for terrorist purposes. Both leaders also expressed support for peace in Ukraine.

title: Siblings who moved to bus rear seat to play survive Himachal Pradesh landslide tragedy
content: A devastating landslide in Bilaspur tragically claimed 16 lives, but two young siblings, Aarushi and Shaurya, miraculously survived. They were playing at the rear of the bus when the landslide struck the front, with the seats shielding them from the crushing debris. The children, who lost their mother, aunt, and cousins, were rescued alive amidst the horrific scene, a testament to sheer luck and resilience.

title: ‘I love Muhammad’ row fallout: Raza gets recovery notice in 28-yr-old Rs 5k loan case
content: Bareilly administration has reopened a 30-year-old loan default case against cleric Maulana Tauqeer Raza. He owes Rs 5,560 from 1990, now Rs 28,386 with interest. This action follows his arrest after recent violence. Authorities are also reviewing other financial and administrative irregularities linked to Raza's network. Demolitions and sealing of premises have occurred. This is part of a wider crackdown on alleged financial and administrative irregularities.

title: ‘Need very badly’: Trump announces Arctic cutters deal with Finland
content: America is set to acquire 11 icebreaking vessels from Finland, a significant move to boost its Arctic presence. President Trump announced the deal, emphasising Finland's expertise in building these crucial ships. This collaboration will see four vessels constructed in Finland and seven in the US, strengthening bilateral defense ties amidst rising Arctic importance.

title: Maharashtra MLA alleges honeytrap and extortion bid, FIR registered in Thane
content: An independent MLA from Kolhapur has filed a complaint against a woman for allegedly honeytrapping and attempting to extort money. The woman reportedly sent obscene content and demanded Rs 5-10 lakh for her father's medical treatment, threatening to ruin his reputation if he refused. Police have registered a case and are searching for the accused.

title: Karnataka approves 12 menstrual leaves a year across sectors
content: Karnataka has approved a groundbreaking policy offering one paid menstrual leave monthly to women across all employment sectors, benefiting over 50 lakh individuals. This move, championed by CM Siddaramaiah, aims to foster a more understanding workplace. The state joins Bihar and Odisha in this initiative, with the Karnataka Menstrual Leave and Hygiene Bill, 2025, proposing 12 days annually for working women.

title: Happy Karwa Chauth 2025: Beautiful images, wishes, messages and quotes
content: Married women across North India observe Karwa Chauth, fasting from sunrise to moonrise for their husbands' well-being. This tradition, rooted in love and devotion, sees women dressing vibrantly and participating in prayer ceremonies. Modern couples increasingly fast together, reflecting evolving marital respect and equality. The festival culminates with moon sighting and breaking the fast.

title: Put ‘cap’: Cab secy instructs ministries to minimise litigations; sends order
content: Government ministries and departments are directed to cap the number of court cases filed to prevent unnecessary litigation and resource wastage. Following a meeting with PM Modi, secretaries are tasked with analysing judgments to minimize future legal disputes. This initiative aims to reduce costs and improve efficiency across government operations.

title: Maria Sharapova & Alexander Gilkes: Dating, engagement, and parenthood timeline
content: Tennis star Maria Sharapova and businessman Alexander Gilkes began dating in 2018. They got engaged in 2020 and welcomed their son Theodore in 2022. The couple prioritizes family and has not rushed wedding plans. They are set to celebrate Maria's International Tennis Hall of Fame induction in 2025, showcasing their enduring bond.

title: Charlie Kirk’s All-American Halftime draws fans, challenges Bad Bunny
content: Turning Point USA is launching a counter-Super Bowl halftime show, 'The All-American Halftime Show,' to rival Bad Bunny's performance. Promising a 'faith, family, and freedom' theme, the event includes a survey asking for music genres, notably offering 'Anything in English.' This move sparks debate over cultural inclusivity versus 'all-American' values, turning the halftime spectacle into a political and cultural battleground.

title: ‘Awaits peace President’: After Nobel nomination Israel invites Trump to address parl
content: Israeli Knesset Speaker Amir Ohana has invited former US President Donald Trump to address the parliament, calling him the "greatest friend and ally of the Jewish people." The invitation highlights Trump's role in brokering regional agreements and recognizing Jerusalem as Israel's capital. This marks a significant gesture of gratitude for his leadership and the US-Israel alliance.

title: Taylor Swift reportedly distances from Blake Lively amid Justin Baldoni legal drama
content: Pop star Taylor Swift and actress Blake Lively are reportedly reconnecting after a year of silence. Sources reveal Swift has made it clear she will not publicly endorse Lively or support her in ongoing legal matters. Apologies have been exchanged regarding Lively's involvement in a lawsuit. Swift's stance indicates a desire to remain uninvolved in the case.

title: Shah holds review of law & order in J&K with top officials, asks them to be on alert
content: Home Minister Amit Shah has urged security forces to maintain 100% alert as winter approaches, warning of potential infiltration attempts by Pakistan and PoK-based terrorists exploiting snowfall. Reviewing the J&K security situation, Shah reiterated the government's commitment to a terrorism-free region, praising efforts to cripple terror networks and assuring continued support.

title: US Sanctions Over 50 Firms, Including Indian Nationals, Over Iran Oil Trade
content: The US Department of the Treasury's Office of Foreign Assets Control (OFAC) on Thursday announced sanctions against more than 50 individuals, entities, and vessels for facilitating Iranian oil and LPG sales and shipments from Iran.

title: "Economic Superpower In Making": UK PM Lauds India's Growth Story
content: British Prime Minister Keir Starmer said on Thursday that India is on track to becoming the third largest economy by 2028, an economic superpower in the making, and the United Kingdom is "perfectly placed to be partners" on that journey.

title: Ex-UK PM Rishi Sunak Joins Microsoft, Anthropic In Advisory Roles
content: Former British Prime Minister Rishi Sunak said on Thursday he has joined U.S. tech giant Microsoft and AI startup Anthropic as a senior adviser.

title: Soon, Delhi Residents Can Apply Birth, Caste Certificates On WhatsApp
content: The Delhi government is working to provide several of its services in a faceless manner, with documents like birth and caste certificates being applied for and delivered using WhatsApp, officials said on Thursday.

title: Punjabi Actor And Bodybuilder Varinder Ghuman Dies Of Heart Attack
content: Professional bodybuilder and actor Varinder Singh Ghuman passed away following a heart attack on Thursday, his family has said.

title: US To Deploy 200 Troops To Monitor And Support Gaza Ceasefire
content: The United States will deploy 200 troops as part of a joint task force for Gaza stability, with no Americans on the ground in the Palestinian enclave, two senior US officials said on Thursday.

title: "We Settled 7 Wars, This Is Number 8": Trump After Gaza Ceasefire Deal
content: US President Donald Trump held a Cabinet meeting at the White House on Thursday morning, a day after announcing that the "first phase" of the Gaza ceasefire agreement between Israel and Hamas would begin soon.

title: Hamas Says It Received Guarantees From Mediators, US Confirming War Ended
content: Exiled Gaza chief Khalil Al-Hayya said on Thursday the group has received guarantees from the United States, Arab mediators, and Turkey that the war in Gaza has permanently ended.

title: Israeli Cabinet Approves "Outline" Of Hostage Release Deal
content: Israel's Cabinet early Friday approved President Donald Trump's plan for a ceasefire in the Gaza Strip and the release of all the remaining hostages held by Hamas, a key step toward ending a ruinous two-year war that has destabilized the Middle East

title: UK PM Hopes Britain Would Become India's Partner Of Choice In Fintech
content: British Prime Minister Keir Starmer has said that India and the UK remain global leaders in financial technology (fintech), as trade and services between the two nations have doubled over the past four years.

title: Trump Says "Stepping Up Pressure" To End Ukraine War
content: US President Donald Trump said Thursday that Washington and NATO allies were "stepping up the pressure" to end the war in Ukraine, after his outreach to Russia's Vladimir Putin failed to achieve a ceasefire.

title: New York Attorney General Letitia James Indicted On Bank Fraud
content: New York Attorney General New York Attorney General Letitia James, a longtime foe of President Donald Trump, was indicted for bank fraud on Thursday, a person familiar with the matter said,, a longtime foe of President Donald Trump, was indicted for

title: Trump Suggests Spain Be Expelled From NATO Over Low Defense Spending
content: President Donald Trump suggested Thursday that Spain be expelled from NATO over its failure to match the higher defense spending requirement he has engineered.

title: Trump To Visit Middle East Sunday Following Gaza Ceasefire Announcement
content: US President Donald Trump said Thursday he plans to leave on Sunday to visit the Middle East following successful negotiations on the first phase of a Gaza peace plan, including a ceasefire and hostage release.

title: PM Modi Congratulates Israeli PM Netanyahu On Gaza Peace Plan
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi spoke with Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu on Thursday to congratulate him on the progress made under US President Donald Trump's Gaza Peace Plan.

title: Luxury Cars, Gold And Honey: Recovery From Retired Madhya Pradesh Engineer
content: Bhopal woke up to a real-life crime thriller on Thursday as the anti-corruption ombudsman Lokayukta raided the residence and properties of retired Public Works Department (PWD) Chief Engineer GP Mehra, uncovering an unbelievable mountain of wealth.

title: Tourist Couple Spends Night At Singapore Airport As Hotel Rates Skyrocket On F1 Weekend
content: It seemed the couple came prepared as they laid out thin blankets and neck pillows on the floor for some good sleep.

title: Woman Dies After Medical Emergency On Disneyland's Haunted Mansion Ride
content: A woman in her 60s died at Disneyland in Anaheim, California, after she reportedly suffered a medical emergency on the Haunted Mansion ride.

title: Ukraine's New Lobbying Tactic: Nominate US President For Nobel Peace Prize
content: Ukraine has yet to convince Donald Trump to put sufficient pressure on Russia to force it to negotiate a peace deal, so it has deployed a new lobbying tactic: nominate the US president for the Nobel Peace Prize.
